• enhances immediate employment opportunities for graduates of vocational education programmes in Germany 
• creates flexible l
Nell-Breuning Schule Rottweil: Chancen nutzen - Kompetenzen erwerben

With the project “Nell-Breuning School Rottweil: Good prospects - acquire skills”, the school offers full-time students, trainees and teachers the possibility to stay for four weeks in Great Britain. The parties involved are the Nell-Breuning school Rottweil sending full-time students, trainees and teachers and Tellus Group, LAF and Twin Group as receiving organisations.

With the support of the Erasmus project the Nell-Breuning school aims for greater internationalisation as well as for an increase of quality in many sectors of school life. Therefore we offer the following activities:

Sending the apprentices for four weeks:
The apprentices are at the end of the first and/or second year within their three-year or two-year training course. The training focuses, on the one hand, on conveying specialist knowledge in the areas of business administration and economy, and the acquisition and/or consolidation of English as a business language on the other. The project aims at helping apprentices to improve their foreign language skills as well as their intercultural and professional competence, benefitting the companies with their labour.
Since the internationalisation of small and medium-sized enterprises will increase in the near future, the demands on employees will also increase.  A high command of English is in demand.

Two-week stay for students at a vocational college focusing on health care. The students leave the vocational college with the German higher education entrance qualifications. They can also attend the course to become an officially recognised assistant in healthcare.

A good command of English and intercultural skills are in high demand for a future working life. The aim is the use and immersion of the professional skills that were acquired at school as well as to get to know the working routine and the business operations in an English company. Furthermore is to mention that the pupils experience the English culture and the British way of life. In this context, the pupils can develop their oral and written skills.

Five oder nine-day stay for teachers:
The students' stay abroad and the lessons at Nell-Breuning need to be linked in a better way. Therefore some colleagues are sent who teach at the vocational college for healthcare as well as at vocational school.
New ideas and impulses are expected through the interaction with European colleagues. Approaches in teaching English as a foreign language and company visits help to develop new skills and gain experience. As a result the teachers are more motivated and the quality of the lessons increases. All in all there is a growth of the quality development at Nell-Breuning school.
  
We pursue the following objectives, in particular:
Promoting the internationalisation of vocational training in Baden-Wurttemberg
Making the stay abroad an integral part of the training
Increasing the attractiveness of teaching sending teachers abroad.
Increasing the attractiveness of the dual training system as well as the vocational college.
Promoting professional, intercultural, social and language skills (mobility, flexibility, independence, self-confidence, etc.)
Expanding the establishment of long-term contacts with foreign companies and suppliers.

The overall aim of all projects is to strengthen the so-called key competencies (linguistic, intercultural and social and personal skills and competences). In addition, all activities should help to develop and strengthen awareness of European values, cultural diversity and foster a strong understanding of cultural differences and how to deal with them. In the long term, this will lead to a sustainable strengthening of European solidarity and an active participation in the European labor market and in the European society.

Project A1.1.:
In this project 450 places of 450 places are awarded for learners as pool places for individual applicants from all over the Federal territory. The quality criteria for the management of pool projects are known and are observed.
The Project „European Internship for Trainees“ is directed at trainees from the commercial business sector throughout Germany. The aim of the project is to strengthen the key competences  and the occupational competence should be strengthened. As a result of globalization, such skills have become essential for future employees to be able to compete on the European market. A total of 450 participants will travel to the destination in groups of at least 10. The project consists of prior preparation in Germany and a three-week learning period in the destination countries. In addition to the preparation participants receive in Germany, they are also provided with a cultural and work-related introduction once they are at thei destination. Participants complete industrial internships in small and medium-sized enterprises in the destination country, gaining an insight into the following areas: Marketing, PR and publicity, administration, accounting, logistics and warehouse organization. In all internships, participants are given the opportunity to interact with customers allowing for targeted use and improvement of their language skills. Participants also have the chance to take part in cultural activities outside of the internship. The project will be supervised and coordinated by both the sending organization in Germany and the receiving organization in the destination country. Additionally a vocational school teacher assists in selecting the participants, preparing them, providing support during their stay abroad and for post-processing the experience. An understanding and a willingness to support such learning experiences abroad during traineeships should be encouraged and promoted on a national level.

Project A1.2. - A2.1.:
The Project „European Internship for Trainees in Bournemouth“ is directed at students completing a full-time school-based traineeship to become commercial assistants. The aim of the project is to strengthen the key competences. The project also focuses on giving trainees the opportunity to gain an insight into international working structures and to acquire practical work experience. As a result of globalization, such skills have become essential for future employees to be able to compete on the European market. Twenty participants will take part in the four-week or six-week program in Bournemouth, UK. Alongside pedagogical and cultural preparation in Germany, participants complete a week-long language and intercultural training course in Bournemouth, followed by the work experience. Internships take place in small and medium-sized enterprises in England, giving participants the chance to gain experience in the following fields: Marketing, PR and publicity, administration, accounting, logistics and warehouse organization. In all internships, participants can interact with customers allowing for targeted use and improvement of their language skills. The project will be supervised and coordinated by both the sending organization in Germany and the receiving organization in England. Additionally a vocational school teacher assists in selecting the participants, preparing them, providing support during their stay abroad and for post-processing the experience. 

Project A2.2.:
The project "European Internship for Trainees after graduation" is designed for 10 graduates from hotel, catering and hospitality sector, having completed a traineeship in Germany and wish to complete a mobility abroad. The ten participants will undertake a four-month learning period abroad consisting of a specialist internship and an introductory course in the destination country. The mobility should allow graduates to develop skills which they gained during their traineeship. This should improve their employment outlook and initiate an interest in international mobility at the beginning of their professional career.
ME.M.O.R.Y. - MEditerranean Memories and mObilities foR Young learners
V.I.E.W. - Vocational International Experiences Working in Europe

The WEE project offers an intensive 2 week program to participants in Exeter, UK or Barcelona in Spain, with on the job vocational work experience, with a value added training framework in business creation & entrepreneurship. This internship involves working with multinational participants in social enterprises in both locations. WEE also offers a 6 week work experience program in London, UK, based in host companies in the sector appropriate to the participants' academic qualifications. 

The project is targeted at recent graduates of VET Colleges, at EFQ levels 5 and 6. The number of participants for the WEE project will be 90 in total.

The project seeks to compliment academic qualifications with result focused work experience, enhancing learner’s employability. The project also equips and energises innovative individuals who look to create their own business, thereby creating employment for themselves, others and contributing to national and European prosperity. Participants will also learn about being innovative, creative problem solving, self-learning initiative and confidence in leadership.

It is expected that the impact of the program will be particularly felt in the employability of participants, and in the area of entrepreneurship development. Participants on completion of the program will have experience of work and develop confidence in such ‘soft skills’ as, working as part of a group, time management, prioritising work tasks etc. Participants will also develop initiative, confidence, problem solving skills and innovation skills. The work experience will be certified by a Europass Mobility document, Declaration of Attendance document and company reference on company headed paper; all of which will be of benefit when applying for jobs. Those participants with an interest in entrepreneurship will be helped to develop and concretise their business ideas by working with social entrepreneurs.
KTS und Europa...ein Mehrwert fürs Leben! (2017)
The Greenwich Hotel T/As Mercure London Greenwich

The present project deals with the implementation of internships of persons in initial vocational training in the following countries : Germany , Great Britain, Spain, Italy, Ireland and Malta.

The participants in this project attend  the Carinthian Tourism School Warmbad Villach, which offers three types of schools : HLT (5 years), HLT for Equine Management Sector and a College (4 semesters ). The participants come from these types of schools. 

Gaining international experience is invaluable for young people and facilitates their later entry into the professional world.

The aim of this project is to improve the independence, flexibility and the language skills of young people, to promote multilingualism, to add practical training and intercultural learning and to lead young people towards an open minded and European way of thinking. Through this training in a European context our students should be enabled to access  the national or the European labour market after their training. This is a major contribution to fight youth unemployment in Europe.

By implementing  ECVET tools  in the project  the creditability of the stay abroad should be facilitated.

Our project partners are both larger and smaller establishments in the hospitality and catering industry  in the above mentioned countries. Our partner companies provide mentors for the students to  introduce them to their new job environment. This ensures a favourable  learning outcome during their stay abroad. It also leads to an international / European image of our school.

The results of the project will be presented on  our open day, during  our information evenings on hospitality training  at the Carinthian Tourism School as well as  at regional information sessions on Erasmus + in our federal state (Carinthia) . Furthermore, we intend to publish articles about our mobility project on our school website and in our annual  report.

Young people benefit a lifetime from skills and competences acquired in an internship abroad and they find it easier to get a job in a weak economy . 

The European network established by  the project promotes mutual understanding and enables our school to react faster  to new challenges  on the labour market .

MOVE: mobility opportunity via eurointernship, project involves 40 mobility of 31 days for students and recent graduates of the different vocational areas of INETE to 10 different destinations. It also implies 6 staff mobility to 3 different vocational schools. In this way we want to know and "bring" to INETE a part of the professional / cultural / linguistic / pedagogical diversity that characterizes Europe, as well as getting to know and participate in the European project. 
 
In this project we positively discriminate targets whose school outcomes are often negative: boys, sons of PALOP emigrants and students in risk of dropout (students with 2 or more years of retention until the 9th grade and with low levels of responsibility and vitality). 20% of the vacancies are aimed for these students. Staff mobility, teachers going to French vocational schools, teacher and head mistress going to a Finnish school are also aimed on getting to know other strategies that promote school success of problematic students. 
 
In this way, we aim to reduce school dropout (number of students who abandon school), reduce school failure (number of students with negative results on school subjects) considering school community but focusing on the targets mentioned above. Also, we aim to increase qualified employment of our students. 
 
This project will continue the school internationalization effort. Since 2011, 64 of our students (59 financed and 5 for self-financing) have already completed internships in countries like Spain, Italy, United Kingdom, Ireland and Hungary through Leonardo Da Vinci and Erasmus+ programmes. In 2017, more 27 mobility will take place (23 students and 4 teachers). 

This project includes partnerships with 4 vocational schools, 1 teachers' association and 5 companies that support and organize local internships and it covers 10 destinations: Spain (Ribadeo, Santiago de Compostela, Madrid, Seville and Barcelona); France (Monteils and Romorantin-Lanthenay); United Kingdom (Belfast and London) and in Rauma, Finland.

In these mobilities students and graduates of the various vocational courses of the school can participate: Management Technician; Accounting Technician; Dispensing Optician Technician; Computing / Programming Technician; Electronics and Automation Technician;  Mechatronics Technician and Car Mechatronics Technician.
The students / graduates will carry out internships in companies in the activity sector of their training and should perform tasks that are part of the professional profile of their course.

Regarding the staff mobilities we intend to observe new teaching strategies and new methodologies to promote success. These will be put into practice in our school, through the action of each teacher involved.

This project is integrated in the European Strategic Development Plan of INETE. This plan aims to achieve the development of a European dimension in our students’ education, in their professional qualification and on the development of school’s human resources. Understanding the role of our school in the 21st century, giving students the skills they need to fully integrate society and the labour market makes us, naturally, more open to Europe and to the world. Being a vocational school, we consider that each project to be developed should add value and help improve employment rates and, as a consequence, widen horizons concerning the labour market level. 
 
The project is part of the objectives of the school by helping to establish a Vocational School of reference, recognized by companies and families, that qualifies professionals valued by economic agents, and assumes the professional qualification as a personal development path from a Lifelong Learning perspective. 
 
Finally, the project aims to contribute to valorise of vocational education in Portugal, through the possibility and dissemination of experiences of young people of this education system to carry out international mobility in qualified areas. It is also intended to send a positive message to school community where we highlight that there are different strategies to promote school success (the goal is to deconstruct the idea that success in vocational education is not achieved by making things easier, but rather to work in a different way).
Consortium Inter-académique de Mobilité Européenne dans l'enseignement professionnel 2017-2019

80% - Rate of families in the Hauts-de-France Region eligible to social assistance
27.7% - Regional unemployment rate for 15-24 year-olds, 3.5 points higher than the national rate
17% - Regional early-school-leaving rate in vocational high school, 40% of young people moving to vocational high school after lower secondary school.

These statistics clearly introduce the social, educational and employment challenges faced by our "academies" in Amiens and Lille, and the necessity to set up ambitious projects to help reduce these proportions.

Our academic projects claim a strong focus on European and international openness. Learning mobility, a means of openness, personal and professional enrichment, development of ambition and motivation, is at the heart of this priority. 
CIME_pro 17 project is an emblematic action of this policy.
Inter-academic consortium of European Mobility in vocational education and training, CIME_pro 17 engages 31 vocational high schools around the GIP FORINVAL in a project deployed on the territory of the "academic region" for a larger impact.

Thanks to the PIMEN projects on Lille side, MOPIC / MOPAAM on Amiens side, CALME_sco, the first inter-academic project, our teams have gradually developed a solid experience in the construction, management, implementation and dissemination of learning mobility projects. This project reflects a common, lasting and growing policy of the Academic Delegations to European and International Relations and Cooperation (DAREIC), working closely together for the entire regional educational community.

The CIME_pro 17 project:
- complements the offer of mobility projects on our territory: MOBinov or PIMEN5 projects for vocational education and training, CALME_sco or MOPAAM16_perso for school staff, CALME_sup for higher education students.
- fosters the common will of our academic teams to work together thanks to mobility projects implemented at the inter-academic level (Lille - Amiens): CALME_sco 2015-2017, CALME_sup 2017-2019, CIME_pro 17.
- pursues the networking of our institutions providing vocational training at the local level (with local economic partners), at the inter-academic level (between institutions of our two academies), at European level (with foreign host partners) .

CIME_pro 17 gives the opportunity to 535 young people from 31 of our vocational high schools to carry out a period of vocational training abroad, mainly young people from disadvantaged socio-professional categories, with little or no appetite for mobility, and for whom, professional and personal future is largely obscured by social problems.

A steering committee, composed of representatives from each member institution and the inter-academic coordination team (DAREICs - GIP), will be the decision-making body of the project and will meet on a quarterly basis.

The dissemination activities will be numerous and will concern all the people involved, especially during the inter-academic days of learning mobility that will be organized on our territory.

The impact of the project will be significant:

On the school career of beneficiairy students:
- development of their interest in mobility, transnational professional mobility becoming a reality for many of them
- increased professional, entrepreneurial, interpersonal, intercultural, linguistic and social skills
- reinforcement of their autonomy, ambition and motivation (increased rate of access to higher education)

On the 160 accompanying staff members or teachers who will carry out a training period abroad, and/or on members of the project teams within the beneficiary institutions
- enriching career paths and developing their professional, intercultural and linguistic skills
- professionalization of educational teams in project management

On the concerned structures:
- contribution to achieving the objectives of school projects in terms of European and international openness
- amplification of the local and inter-academic influence of the sending schools
- qualitative and quantitative improvement in the school guidance of lower-secondary-school students to these high schools.
- enrichment and sustainability of partnerships at European level (host partners abroad) and at the local level (reception of foreign students for institutions that implement reciprocal exchanges)

Within our inter-academic territory (Hauts-de-France region)
- Networking of schools and enhanced cooperation between our two academies
- Harmonization and pooling of practices

CIME_pro 17 is an essential and ambitious project for a territory with major challenges.

CONTEXT & OBJECTIVES
Twin wish to carry out the European Mobility for Career Development (EMCD) project because it will provide unique vocational development and career progression opportunities for our learners working towards Level 3 qualifications in Digital Media, Leadership & Management and Teaching English as a Foreign Language (TEFL).

The EMCD project will provide long-term Mobility Placements lasting for 3-months within the hospitality and education sectors in Spain and Ireland. The content and length of the Mobility Placements has been designed to meet the career development aims of our Level 3 learners in these sectors, the majority of whom will have completed a Level 2 qualification and have some experience in entry level roles but are looking to move into more senior and better paid roles within their chosen field.

The EMCD project will also deliver the following complementary objectives that support the overall aim of enhancing the employability of our Level 3 learners within the target sectors:

SUPPORTING CULTURAL AND LINGUISTIC DEVELOPMENT: In addition to developing their vocational and workplace skills, Mobility Placements will offer a transformational life experience for our learners, many of whom will have had limited opportunities to travel abroad and certainly will not have lived and worked in another country.

ENHANCING OUR VOCATIONAL PROVISION: Integration of Mobility Placements within our vocational courses will enhance our provision for the target sectors. In particular, working with employers in Spain and Ireland will help to introduce European dimensions within the curricula of the courses linked to Mobility Placements and will broaden the perspectives of both tutors and learners.

DEVELOPING OUR PARTNERSHIPS WITH EMPLOYERS: Twin already has excellent links with local and regional employers and the work undertaken in developing this application has already enabled us to establish partnerships with employers within the target sectors in Spain and Ireland.

PARTICIPANTS
Project participants will be VET learners currently undertaking or having recently completed Level 3 vocational qualifications related to the hospitality and language teaching sectors and the specific courses where we propose to offer mobility opportunities to learners are:

-  ILM Level 3 Certificate in Principles of Leadership and Management
-  City & Guilds Level 3 Award in Principles of Website Creation and Optimisation
-  LRN Level 3 Certificate in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL)

ACTIVITIES
The core activities that the EMCD project will deliver will be 90 mobility work placements within the hospitality and language teaching sectors in Spain and Ireland.  We intend to deliver the 90 mobilities in the 3 groups of 30, with each group being broken down as follows: 14 Leadership and Management (8 to Spain, 6 to Ireland), 8 Digital Media to Spain and 8 TEFL to Spain.

The project will work with 27 Host Employers, which will facilitate effective matching of mobility work placement opportunities with the learning aims and career development aspirations of our participants. In addition to providing work experience for the participants, Host Employers will contribute to other key functions, including recruitment and selection, preparation and post placement support.  

METHODOLOGY
The methodologies adopted by the EMCD project will focus on working in partnership with Host Employers in the destination countries that have the experience, expertise, organisational capacity and range of business activities that will support our learners in developing experience-acquired skills for their vocational area by working alongside established professionals in their chosen field.  Working in different sectors and with such a broad range of Host Employers will mean that no two mobilities will be exactly the same but they have been designed to both enable participants to put the skills learned during their VET courses into practice and take on additional responsibility and adapt to more senior roles within the workplace.

RESULTS AND IMPACT
The project will deliver major impacts for the participants in terms of job outcomes and career development.  We expect that 73% (66 of 90) will enter employment within 3 months of completing their mobility and, of those, 91% (60 of the 66 moving into work) will sustain employment for at least 6 months. We also expect the project to benefit the labour market mobility of participants and expect at least 11% (10 of 90) to take up jobs in other EU countries. 

The project will also build the capacity of partners to participate in transnational activities in general and the Erasmus+ programme in particular.  Furthermore, over the medium to long term, evaluation and dissemination functions will engage with VET providers and enterprises within the target sectors more widely across the EU and thus offer potential to inform developments in VET provision at the European level.
Stage de formation professionnelle à l'étranger pour élèves de section européenne

This journey’s first objective is to allow young high school students to discover the world but also to obtain their vocational high school diploma management administration with an European mention (distinction). Thanks to this internship (training course), which is important in their school program, they will gain in maturity and can also continue their studies abroad even to reach a BTS in International Trade or quite different BTS where the (spoken) languages are important and are a selected criteria.
Our partner is Twin Group, which is a well established work experience provider based in the UK, offering placements in the Nation’s capital, London, and the peaceful seaside town of Eastbourne at the South coast of England.
Twin Group is now a Superstar Work Experience provided as voted for by our partners and peers at the Language Travel Magazine’s annual Star Awards. They won this award 5 times over a 7 year period, and were shortlisted in the years they didn't win. They work with international organisations from all over the world, and typically work with over 4000 candidates for our programs every year, and have many years of experience with handling and managing European funded programs, ensuring that all paperwork is completed as required as well as ensuring the applicants have an engaging, challenging, and fulfilling experience in London.

Twin Group receives many groups every year from funded organisations, schools, colleges and universities, offering opportunities for students to gain a professional work experience in the UK, either in London or Eastbourne. They work with a large portfolio of placement companies, and are always happy to explore new areas in which they provide internships for our customers, as the level of vocational education increases across the EU under Erasmus Plus.
This stay will allow them to validate their diploma, it will be a way (means) for them who already made their internships (training courses) to compare the administration or the English companies with those of their country. 
So for their following studies, they will have a wider choice during their next training course.
This group consists of 16 young students of the same class, almost all minors. 
They will be accompanied by two of their teachers, from country of origine, that will have the heavy task to be present and guide them and prevent any possible problems but also to manage their regular evaluation in the company.
During their stay in England, the students will stay at host families. Like this they will get to know the way of life in English families and this will help/push them to communicate all the time in English to boost their level.
During the first week, they will be in a training center every morning to deepen their knowledge in corporate communication in English and in the afternoon they will spend time at their company. The remaining weeks will only take place in a company from Mondays to Fridays. On Saturdays, there will be an update with the head of the organization. The students and teachers will be guided with a visit through the region. We will use all the means of communication within our possibilities.
This project has been thoroughly studied and monitored by the teaching team, our high school officials and the parents of our students (to allow us to set up lucrative actions), and our partner in the UK, to answer the Better for all needs. Even that our establishment is private, we have a very diverse group of students and their only goal is to make it a success. 
Indeed, in vocational high school often the students who have enrolled there, have already suffered school failures, even if our institution is private, we have a very diverse public whose only goal is to succeed. Through this project, a group came out, supported by their parents, the parents' association and the high school. So the differences between the pupils are smaller , all having as objective the obtaining of their Baccalaureate and a opening to Europe thanks to an internship abroad.
For this internship (training course) in England, we would like to thank our host families, the companies and the organisations that support and help us with our project, we hope that this is a long-lasting relationship and that we can send every two years our students to validate their internship (training course).
To conclude, an exhibition (exposure) will be made at the high school when they return to share their real-life experience and also to thank all our partners.

Skills for work, skills for life

Main activities - internationalization strategy
The mobility plan proposed for the second year of implementation of the school  international strategy involves 50 students’ and 10 teachers/ staff’s mobility for training activities and is aimed at:
- Stimulating the integration of the  international guidance into the curriculum
- Developing and updating teachers’ skills in  planning the students’ placements abroad 
- Strengthening the  awareness of the skills required by the current labor market.
- Modeling the links established with the labor market actors, both in the creation of internships and  in the development of partnerships.
The internship activity  will be consistently integrated into the students’ curriculum,  revisited following the 2010 reform  and organized not as a list of contents, but by competences, identified through a high level of joint planning by the disciplinary groups,  involving  departments for cultural axes, too.
The school strategy chosen for the European internationalization is based on a careful consideration of the final competences of the different courses to ensure its consistency with the training requirements of the territory, characterized by innovation processes  and the export  vocation  to the  global markets. The training activities planned aim to consolidate partnerships with the territory for a detailed analysis of needs and to bridge the gap between training and business needs. The planning and the implementation of the  internships are designed to overcome the seemingly irreconcilable separation between study and labor market  in line with "Europe 2020" and the '' Agenda for New Skills and Jobs "

2) Change of scope of the mobility flow
Students
The 50 internships, lasting three weeks, are aimed to integrate into the curriculum international mobility with an approach geared towards Personal Learning Environment (PLE). This implies that students will be able to use different methods and techniques designed to enhance soft skills: e-Learning on one side and the experiential self-learning in the company on the other hand, without  distinction between the two different times.
In line with the  PLE methodology the placements will be designed to:
- Address the specific needs of the local  territory and the professional profile of each trainee
- Experience transversal skills in the real production environment
- Broaden the horizons of young people and educate them to mobility
- Strengthen the future employability through experiences that can add value to the curriculum
Students will develop interpersonal skills; team working; critical thinking; autonomy and pro-activity by interacting with representatives of the business community with whom to share objectives and interests and exchange information and knowledge.
The internship also represents an important opportunity to put into practice the language skills acquired and to promote linguistic diversity. The active collaboration with the Polish branch of Leonardo Company Finmeccanica Group has created awareness and interest in the Polish language. The participants in placements  in Poland will attend a literacy course to Polish in order to use the national language as the language  during the internship.

The 10 internship experiences  lasting one week will enable teachers/staff  to:
- Analyze the soft skills required by the companies appearing on the target markets of local companies
- Receive incentive for educational innovation and test new forms of cooperation in the education sector;
- Plan work placements in an  international context;
- Promoting the comparison in the field of certification of skills in formal and non-formal learning
- Improve language skills;
- Promote the transfer of new organizational methods based on collaboration and teamwork;
- Promote the acquisition of  skills and attitudes that favor the management of change in the workplace.

3) accompanying Teachers
As provided by the guidelines of Erasmus + each stream of trainee students will be accompanied by a sending school official for a short period of time, 5 days + two journeyl, to optimize the cost / benefits, but enough to :
- To verify the insertion of the trainee in the new reality
- Check the quality of  accommodation
- Make arrangements with the host institution's tutor and the company’s  tutor
- Ensure the integration in the company and subscription stages of Learning and Training agreements.

It is the declared goal for Mercantec to give as many students as possible an international experience in the course of their edcation. Mercantec is working continuesly to improve the mobilities in order to give the students the best possible experiences and a strenghting of their education. Mercantec har kept the partners from the application submitted in 2016 but also bringing in new partners to broaden the selection of educations and to include as many departments as possible. Among these new partner there is an Irish school for our Higher technical Gymnasium who has a very interesting game design education. This new partner has been added with the intent to exchange teachers and in the future to develop the working relationship to include student mobilities as well. Two new partners for our construction department, a partner from Iceland and one from Estonia. The estonian partner has an exciting education as log house builder.
Mercantec sends students from every department of the school. Higher Business Gymnasium sends a class to Malaga for work placements and language courses. From the hotel and restaunt school, mercantec sends students to Malloca, Hungary, Hennef, rakvere and Cypres. The students come from GF2 and the practice center. House of Technology sends students from the practice center for IT supporter and Data technician to Malta and Neumünster. HOT has a cooperation with Grundfos, LEGO and B&O where students from these companies are sent to ABB and Neumünster. Auto Technical Center sends students from the practice center to Neumünster, Troisdorf, mallorca, Westport and Rakvere. Metalcraft sends students form the practice center to Neumünster and Tarnow i Poland. Higher Technical Gymnasium will have visitors from Galway Ireland and also visit the irish school, with the intent build a mobility relationship for Game design. The construction school sends carpeters, painters and concrete workers to Hennef, mallorca, Iceland and Pärnuu. The students come from the practice center, GF2 and main courses. The Business School sends students from the practice center and EUX to London, mallorca, Malta and we are working on a futur cooperation with two school from Ireland (Galway and Kerry), as well as sending students from the practice center to Portugal.
Erasmus+ mobilities is the corner stone for Mercnatec's international work. The program enable us to give the most number of students an international scope on their education. Our experience is that our students come home with many positive experiences from their mobilities and they are willing to participate in new mobilities. Our experience is that more and more students are asking about the danish PIU (Pratice abroad) programme. 
We have, to optimize our selection of partners and thereby educations, been to a contact seminar in Dublin with the danish NA, where we were able to amke some very good new contacts. these new contacts/partners have been added to this application. We expect that there will be an introduction fase and we are palnning to visit the new partners before sending students. Mercantec has a goal to develop Erasmus+ mobilities which are longer than 3 weeks, and a new partner in Portugal has this oppotunity. the partner has a cooperation with two companies, which would be able to host business students for 7 weeks. We know that we might have a challenge with finding the students but nevertheless  we know that the students would like these longer lasting placements.
We plan to visit our German partners in February/March. This visit is to improve our relationship and explore possible future areas of cooperation. The participants on this trip is the heads of educations from the individual departments as well as the head of the international department and the international coordinator. Another goal for the trip is to explore the possiblity of finding PIU placemnts for Danish students in Germany. The focus is on VET and EUX students. A visit to the Xarxa partner Munich is also palnned for 2017.
Mercnatec is a member of the Xarxa FP which is a cooperation between cities in Europa and their VET schools. We are working on a cooperation with Alcoi in Spain for both KA1 an KA2. The cooperation with Alcoi has resulted in two PIU placements, in which Danish students are doing work experience in Spanish companies. Mercantec is already welcoming students from Xarxa partners and therefore there is a big future potential in developing Mercantec's Erasmus+ mobilities. 
We are sending a teacher along on mobilities due to the fact that most of our students are coming from the practice centers and these students are not the most ressourcefull students. A lot of them has never travelled for longer periods before. It therefore nessesary to send a teacher along to secure the success for the student in order to make future international experiences possible. This is in line woith our international strategy to send 30 students per year on PIU work placements

The purpose of the mobility project is to strengthen the cultural, academic, vocational and linguistic skills of both teachers and students in an international context and to ensure the development of the HTX-training and the international profile of AATG. Development and implementation of this project are a continuation of good and fruitful results from nine years of focus on international internships and school attendance for HTX students and are an important part of AATG's overriding Globalization strategy and strategy for interaction with companies and the world around us. The project is part of a broad internationalization effort at AATG. During the period 2017-2019 the focus is in particular on teacher mobility to support the college’s profile as an international upper secondary school, which is part of academic networks both internationally and nationally.    
Activities: 
Student mobility. The target group of the project is students from four study lines in which technology, communications / IT, design or English are majors. In this way, we ensure that the internships will form a natural part of the students’ HTX training in accordance with the legal requirement: BEK nr. 740 af 23/06/2010 §29 which requires some teaching to be provided in a work place context.  These study programmes are GLOBALTECH, MEDIATECH, Experience Design and Emergency Services. The partners in the project will complete a Learning Agreement before the student’s departure. The students participate in three- or four-week internships in London or Barcelona depending on the study line  during 2nd or 3rd Year. London and Barcelona have been chosen because of the opportunities to add to the profile of the study lines a new and innovative approach to the subject’s traditions and teaching environments with communication, IT and Design as well as improving the students’ English language skills. In Barcelona English will also be the work language for most internships. The objectives for the students are:
• That they develop their professional, intercultural and personal skills in such a way that they can be part of a globalized labor- and educational market later in their education.
• That students become familiar with and gain an understanding of the requirements for the individual working in a globalized labor market.
• That students upon their return can provide new and innovative approaches to subjects taught at AATG.
Generally, we assess the skills of HTX students as being adequate for a course of this character and length, the students are between 17 and 19 years old. We will carry out a three-part assessment to ensure the best implementation and placement in a company and host family. Based on previous experience, we expect to send off about 90-95% of the students in the classes, which are part of the project. 
Teacher mobility. The objective for employee/ teacher mobility is:
- That the teachers develop their knowledge and pedagogic approach within their own subject through observation and participation in work placement with companies and job shadowing at education institutions in language teaching, design, technology and communication technical study lines.
- That the teachers develop their own knowledge and understanding of what is required of the students in a globalized labor market.
- That the teachers upon their return may add to the study lines new and innovative approaches to the subjects. 
The participants in this project are students and teachers from study lines, which have an increased focus on both internationalization, the global labor market and interaction with companies.
The purpose of the mobility project is therefore aimed at several levels: special academic development and fulfillment of targets, practical experience and knowledge of companies, development of personal, linguistic and intercultural skills for student/ teacher and fulfillment of the College’s strategic internationalization strategy.  
It has been agreed that the distribution of responsibility and roles among the participants in the project is as follows: 
AATG: Project management, practical and educational planning. Completing assessment. Organizing stays and transport. TWIN-UK/ Venga Travel: Participate in assessment for internships. Responsible for contracts with companies. Arrange accommodation including food, local transport, supervision and teaching in English/ Spanish.
The project will be implemented two times with each time lasting one year and with a total of ten student flows. At the same time, nine teacher flows will take place.Throughout the project the following management documents will be used: Contract, Learning Agreement, Europass CV, Language Europass as well as Europass Mobility certificate. The students use Online Language Assessment and a Europass Mobility Certificate will be issued for students at end of their internship.
